oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bluff Furnace
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space
Work
Furnaces; Iron industry and trade
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Print from stereoscope of the Bluff Furnace (Tennessee River Bluff Iron Works).

The East Tennessee Iron Manufacturing Company was incorporated in 1847, and was an important part of the iron and railroad industry. The Bluff Furnace began operation in 1856. In May 1860, it was converted to a coke-fueled furnace. In November 1860, it failed during operations, and the furnace was demolished.
